intro: Eupatorium microdon, commonly known as white boneset, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Its small, white to pale blue flowers bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. The leaves are usually aromatic and have a rough texture, contributing to its ecological role in supporting insect life.
